alert.note: Alert for Sheridan; Western Cherry (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 27 at 3:18AM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Cherry and northeastern Sheridan Counties through 300 AM MDT... At 218 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Wolf Creek Housing, or 10 miles southeast of Pine Ridge, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Merriman, Hoover Lake, Irwin, Mount Maria and Shell Lake State Wildlife Management Area. This includes the following highways... Highway 20 between mile markers 122 and 138. Highway 61 between mile markers 219 and 230. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in North Platte.
